I don’t know that I expect a huge rally for United Parcel Service (NYSE:UPS) after it reports earnings on Wednesday.
With analysts expecting a 30% rise in earnings and 40% growth in revenue, Q2 numbers likely will remind investors just how cheap, and attractive, Facebook stock really is.
When it comes to the best stocks to invest in right now, there’s no better time than earnings season, when strong numbers can provide an upside catalyst to a stock.
An investor has to go all the way back to Q1 2015 for the last quarter that Facebook didn’t beat Street estimates for both revenue and earnings.
Initial reports seem reasonably strong, with big banks like JP Morgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) and Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) posting strong numbers.
There are plenty of reasons to expect strong performance from the market as a whole – and to look for potential winners who can outperform.
A new delivery initiative from Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) added to competitive fears, and sent shares of UPS and FedEx (NYSE:FDX) tumbling.
Amazon is a rival — but it’s also a key customer, and e-commerce growth should keep the UPS market expanding for years to come.
UPS stock’s own guidance for higher capital expenditure spend to improve its delivery offering has further worried investors.
There are some mid-term concerns here about potentially slowing user growth and, more specifically, higher operating costs.
A strong quarter for UPS might lead investors to stop focusing solely on the risks — and more on the positives here.
And good numbers might remind investors that this is a pretty solid business trading at less than 15x earnings.
The U.S. economy is healthy, unemployment is low and overseas markets are recovering, particularly in Europe.
But I still think, as I wrote last month, that UPS is one of the better stocks to own for the second half.
All five have solid long-term bull cases — and reasons to expect upside from upcoming earnings reports.
